meanings.definition: To pursue someone or something to the point of exhaustion or defeat.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah outpursued the gazelle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The detective outpursued the criminal until he was caught.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner outpursued the finish line, determined to reach it.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition outpursued any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The relentless waves outpursued the sandcastle, washing it away.

meanings.definition: To be pursued to the point of exhaustion or defeat.
meanings.sent1: The gazelle was outpursued by the cheetah in the race.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was outpursued by the detective until he was caught.
meanings.sent3: The finish line outpursued the exhausted marathon runner.
meanings.sent4: Defeat outpursued him, but he never gave up.
meanings.sent5: The darkness outpursued the flickering light, engulfing it completely.
